title: Sadly disappointed with service
comment: I’ve been to Gezi Park numerous times and I really like the food. So I took my friend there this week to have the cold meze after a long walk. We sat outside due to the social distancing and ordered our food. The service so far seemed ok and nothing to complain about. As we began eating the various dishes I noticed that the hummus tasted funny and I asked my friend what she thought. She said it tasted ‘fizzy’ which meant it was ‘old’ and I agreed. We didn’t eat any more of it and called the waiter over and told him. He said ‘ok’ and disappeared inside to the restaurant- we thought to get fresh hummus. He didn’t return. So then I called the waitress over and told her the same thing. She said ‘ok I tell’ and she disappeared off inside. She didn’t come back either. We soon finished the rest of the food and asked for the bill assuming that the complaint re the hummus would be reflected in the total of the bill. She brought the bill and said nothing about the hummus and there was no reduction in the cost. She went to get the card machine and when she returned I asked her to take off the service charge because we couldn’t eat the hummus. She said ‘service charge is automatic’ so I said ‘as we couldn’t eat the hummus and you didn’t replace Or apologise for it we won’t be paying for it’ She was very hostile and grabbed my friends card from her Hand and muttered something while shoving it into the machine. We were really taken aback. My friend asked for the receipt and the waitress literally threw it in front of her on the table!  As we got up to leave the waitress whipped the remaining dishes off the table and gave us the dirtiest looks almost throwing us out. My friend has the receipt but to be honest we didn’t even check if she took off a couple of Quid (service charge £2.30) as we were so relieved just to leave at that point.  I emailed the restaurant later explaining how surprised we were at this hostile treatment and asking for a manager to contact me but had no reply whatsoever.  I’d like to think that if a manager knew that one of his staff treated customers in such a manner they would be reprimanded as it shouldn’t bring the reputation of the whole business into disrepute  However I have no evidence that anyone bothered to pick up on the issues.  So with that in mind - much as I like the food - I won’t be returning

title: Perfect Birthday Take Away!
comment: Picked up a take away, staff were friendly and let us sit inside to wait for it. I had a lovely vegetarian kebab, the vegetables were nice and chunky and the sauce was gorgeous!, The birthday boy had a chicken and lamb Shish kebab and wasn’t disappointed. Both meals came with salad, rice and bread. Perfect meal.

title: Lovely Friday night
comment: Enjoyed a lovely meal, excellent value and very good quality. well presented, nice service and a lively buzz around the restaurant

title: been here 5 or 6 times . . .
comment: I will say this is not exactly cheap but we have never had a bad meal in here. We generally always visit on the off chance when passing by. It is mostly always busy, if you are going after 7 you definitely need to book. We visited at 6 on Saturday and went for the fish option, salmon and sea bass, it really was so lovely. They did not rush us out either. Service is added to your bill, I think they should bring the change no matter how small just out of courtesy but overall this is worth visiting.

title: Fantastic food & fantastic service
comment: We had an amazing dinner here, the service was outstanding and the food was melt in the mouth!! Couldnt have asked for better size portions. The waiting staff were on point and never let us have an empty glass, very attentive and friendly. Serving the bill in the little box was such a lovely touch!! Will certainly be going back.

title: SATURDAY NIGHT MEAL
comment: Enjoyed a lovely meal, top quality, Good menu choice, well presented authentic cuisine, very nice service, lovely ambience well worth a visit

title: Not Covid-19 Ready
comment: If you have any anxiety to covid 19, this is not the restaurant for you as this restaurant is not complying to government rules. Non of the waiting staff are wearing face masks. Most customers are coming into the restaurant with no face masks on, whilst being taken to their tables.  Whilst we where sat at our pre booked table, another 2 people came in to eat without a booking. No contact details where taken from them. I was very surprised the waitress allowed them to chose the table to sit at. They chose a table next to us, which they had to squeeze past behind us, whist not wearing a face covering. This table did not allow the right amount of distance from our table, which caused me and my husband to have to move up along our table, whilst we were eating. We also noticed seated areas where not sanitised after use. I spoke to a member of staff regards these situations, which they knew they were breaking the rules but felt they could not work with following the rules. My husband and I , paid for the food we ate, then left the restaurant as we did not feel safe.  Shame the starter we had we enjoyed. Would I go back again, no. The food maybe lovely but the restaurant has no ambience or style that add to diners enjoyment.

title: Good food but misleading
comment: This is a review of their takeaway. The food is very good. But the bill was more than expected and its now very expensive. The lady told me the prices on the menu you see online are very out of date. There was no apology, and they were pretty dismissive - apparently the website has been out of date for years! I left feeling ripped off. A shame because like I say the food is good but there are lots of good Turkish restaurants and I wont be going back to Gezi Park.

title: Absolute disgrace no social
comment: Absolute disgrace no social distancing on the night before the 2nd lockdown they sat people 50cm apart and even used tables with red crosses on! When I challenged this they said it didn’t matter it was the last night!!!! Very irresponsible. The food is bland and overpriced the service is negligent. I would strongly recommend you avoid this overpriced excuse for a restaurant.

title: Overpriced, stingy portions
comment: I have previously ordered from here and it was just ok, but noticed the babaganoush was mostly yoghurt (cheap) and v little aubergine (more expensive ingredient). We decided to give it one more try and ordered a shish kebab with rice, some falafel, some tabule and bread and it came to £30, which seems excessive. On impulse we bought baklava when collecting the take away too - £3 for 3 tiny pieces (the foil tray is an extra small one). Feels like a waste of money and won’t be coming back.

title: Distinctly average
comment: Distinctly average  Had a delivery on a Thursday evening. The food was luke warm and absolutely no fresh salad or parsley, which I thought would be a standard accompaniment to the lamb kebabs. The lamb was tasty and tender but the hot meze was a little on the greasy side.

title: Excellent food and service
comment: We dined here with friends on a Sunday lunch time. The food was very good and they catered for both vegetarian and our 2 year old very well. Good customer service too .

title: 2nd times a charm!
comment: This was our second visit and a large last minute birthday booking. We had a superb lunch there yesterday. Honestly everything was seamless and it’s so refreshing to have found such a special place. 17 of us had a great celebration and we were really taken care of. The team there are so friendly, so helpful and the service is amazing. The food is delicious, extremely tasty and very reasonably priced. My nephew has severe allergies but they were able to accommodate him and ensure he has something to eat which he thoroughly enjoyed. A huge thank you to the Gezi Park Team for looking after us and providing exceptional service and food. We all had a wonderful time and will definitely be back (we will hopefully give you a little more notice next time)  There is nothing not to love about this place, if you have not tried it yet you are missing out!

title: A Turkish gem in Wanstead
comment: I have lunched many times with friends at Gezi Park and the food is divinely delicious. The halloumi cheese starter and the chicken sish just melts in your mouth . Good sized portions and plenty of pepper chili sauce on the house. The staff are welcoming and very obliging . Strongly recommend Gezi Park . You will be returning again and again

title: Family dinner
comment: Best Turkish restaurant ever friendly staff,friendly owner super atmosphere,highly recommended.Lovely food

title: Very disappointing Valentines meal
comment: Set menu £27.50 pp. This has been a favourite restaurant of ours so we’re really disappointed by the whole experience. Restaurant had a “Special” menu but nothing special about the experience. Candles on table which were not even lit. Food took ages. Hot Meze starter was a plate of fried food, even halloumi was fried. Meat platter uninspiring. Such a shame . Next time we will need to check if they have a special menu and avoid.

title: Getzi is our ideal romantic evening
comment: The staff are always welcoming and attentive without being intrusive. Delicious food and wine/ coffee. The music adds to the fantastic ambience❤

title: Best Restaurant on Wanstead High Street
comment: Great food, great flavour, great service! The ambience is great, atmosphere is friendly and it’s just a wonderful place to dine. Having been to all the restaurants on the high street, this is the best!

title: service
comment: The food was good no complain, the disappointment was the different treatment. We had to call the severes few times to get our drinks or even starters but the table next to us were treated better plus they were at their beck and call while we had to wait several times to get their attention, towards the end I notice they offered them drinks on the house ( the restaurant is very tight in space so they are right beside us) and gave them a card to give reviews, even then we had to call them to get our bill and to pay as well we had to keep getting their attention I m not bothered about the free drinks it’s just the different treatment for us being Asians I felt quite uncomfortable. I never have experienced this before, and it’s not nice to be that spot, for this reason I will never go again. Ps we spent the same money as the table beside us.

title: Repulsive old rancid food
comment: Repulsive old rancid food - ordered a delivery from here as we are in lockdown and it was absolutely disgusting and cost over £40 for 3 dishes and houmous. The main was just one kebab and a bit of rice. Other restaurants do an entire platter for £20. But I thought since I like this place when I eat in it will be worth the £9-12 per dish I was paying. It was not. The salad was out of a bag, with nothing else added to it not even lemon juice, it was just leaves, not the usual you get when you eat in with carrots, pomegranates etc. The meat was dry and horrible as if it was cooked a long time ago not freshly. And then there was the ‘home made’ baklawa. It was OLD. It had gone off, I took a bite and had to spit it out. It was soft smelt and tasted like cheese that had gone off. Absolutely repulsive. It was also £4.50 for 3 pieces. How can they send food like that to people? It was not home made and had clearly been laying around for a LONG time. The order arrived far too quickly as well so it was clear it wasn’t freshly cooked. I do not recommend this place at all. Hygiene isn’t up to scratch during these coronavirus times clearly. Which is just dangerous. I will never order or eat in here again.

title: Great service and ambiance
comment: My wife and I together with our two daughters had lunch.Great service. Lovely ambiance.Helpful staff.

title: Mrs
comment: Tonight was the best night spent in a Turkish restaurant ever!  I have had family members invited for dinner, and we all have been so happy about the food and all we have been pampered!  Especially from the beginning we have been greeted by Hassan and he looked after us so professionally from the beginning till the end! We will recommend this restaurant to my family members, and we definitely are coming back! Food was delicious and served with a big smile!

title: Reliably good charcoal grilled yumminess.
comment: I've been to Gezi many times and it is consistenly my favourite restaurant in Wanstead. It just does what a good place should do - reliably serving delicious plates of food (along with good service) every time - in this case, delicious charcoal grilled meats.

title: Great restaurant
comment: Have been here a few times now, good food and the staff are attentive and pleasant. It’s very clean and has s nice atmosphere. Worth a visit

title: selected dishes...❤️
comment: If you look for one romantic night , for delicious food and for warm service, I recommend 100% gezy park , I was many times and I can’t wait to going again , thank you very to Ana for the nice atmosphere and nice service !

title: Great staff great restaurant
comment: Hey guys, looking for lovely dinner delicious food exceptional service and brilliant atmosphere there is only one I recommend to you that is gezi park well recommended you won't be disappointed

title: Joanne
comment: We had a special occasion with the family last saturday at Gezi Park and the service was superb, the food was excellent and the staff especially the manager Hassan, waitress Anna were both brilliant. Ofcourse i dont have to mention Alex what a great man! Definitely will be back soon!

title: Wow!!
comment: This place is amazing, the best Turkish food , the best atmosphere (relaxing music) . I eat combination sish wich was delicious , portion is big and nice looking plate. Attentive staff and friendly! Thank you very much Gezi park team!!

title: Great evening
comment: Was there last night with some friends, the food and atmosphere was amazing,thanks Alex for the great service. Will be back soon.

title: Delicious
comment: Can’t say i’ve tried Turkish food other than a late night greasy kebab, but this was lunch and so delicious, a revelation! Well priced, well presented, delicious and filling, thank goodness I didn’t have to work afterwards. Great staff, attentive and good with kids. Overall very impressed, thank you for a wonderful experience.

I highly recommend this restaurant It is my favourite restaurant so far to visit with family and friends, it has an amazing atmosphere with delicious food and not to mention the staff are always so accommodating Will definitely be back. :)

title: Wow!
comment: Today I visited this great Turkish restaurant with my boyfriend and we had a fantastic time. The food was delicious, the atmosphere very relaxing (excellent playlist, by the way), the staff super friendly and the bread, in particular, was outstanding. I cannot wait to go back! Thank you, Gezi Park!

title: Amazing food
comment: Amazing food, friendly staff & very welcoming.  Best Turkish restaurant in wanstead. Definitely visiting again

title: Oh my god!
comment: Well, what can I say. My first ever visit to a Turkish restaurant and I am blown away. The bread alone is unbelievable, add a salad and a mixed kebab and now Turkish food is my favourite food. Where has this been all my life. Please try this restaurant, it’s quite frankly superb

title: Best Turkish food ever
comment: We ate here for the 1st time having travelled from Buckinghamshire especially to me up with friends. We all loved the ambience, good and the hospitality was excellent. Big thanks to our beautiful and friendly waitress Ana for the excellent service with a smile. We are vegetarian so all the dishes we ordered were so so tasty  My absolutely favourite was Mucver with yoghurt -fried mounds of grated courgette,herbs and cheese served with strained yoghurt ! Will definitely travel all the way back here for a meal

title: Lovely food
comment: I went with my friend and her daughter. The atmosphere is nice.  I ordered Albanian liver which was very nice. The chicken shish was nice. My friend had the calamari main n she enjoyed it. The bread and buttery rice they serve you can’t stop eating! You probably don’t need starters.  The mint tea was nice but probably doesn’t need lemon added to it. The liqueur coffee was lovely. My friend enjoyed her rose wine.  Service charge is added. 3 ppl bill was £85.  Customer service was nice but when we stayed longer than others we got a sense they wanted us to leave. But we ignored that n just enjoyed ourselves so I dropped a star for that. No one likes feeling their welcome has ended.

title: Fantastic visit
comment: Amazing food. Absolutely amazing. Very friendly staff. They moved tables to make room for our pram with our baby sleeping on a Friday night so week could enjoy a much needed dinner out. Thank you.

title: Made my day
comment: We went here for a quiet birthday lunch, first time we’ve visited. Staff were very friendly, looked after us well and lunchtime deal was a bargain. Mentioned in passing when I ordered my coffee that it was my birthday and look what arrived with it. Thanks

title: Lunch in the park
comment: Went here for lunch and really couldn’t fault anything. The food was excellent, beautifully cooked and generously portioned given the low price. Can’t wait to go again, thoroughly revommended

title: I don’t recommend
comment: Very expensive restaurant. Medium quality food. They charge for Service charge. I don’t recommend. .

title: Amazing food, atmosphere and staff
comment: We visited with friends to gezi park we ordered a variety of food from the menu and sides. It was all beautiful. We enjoyed every single moment highly recommend and will definitely visit again. Very welcoming staff too lovely place

title: Nice Turkish restaurant on the high road
comment: Very nice food. Pleasant atmosphere (big aquarium for the kids to enjoy!) and good service. Good value for money.

title: Delicious food and friendly service
comment: We really enjoyed our Meal! Food was flavousom and plentiful. Highly recommend the fish platter. Great swift service.

title: Family friendly
comment: Great food. Always feel welcome. We love it here! Hassan always ensures we are being looked after.  Family friendly restaurant, highly recommended.

title: Great Turkish restaurant
comment: It's a lovely Turkish restaurant. Delicious food and great customer service. Me and my boyfriend have been couple of times and we would highly recommended.

title: Great meal
comment: Always made to feel welcome by the friendly staff, food is always on point with a great selection. Highly recommended.

title: Last minute celebration & the perfect choice
comment: Booked a last minute table for a family birthday this evening, more people turned up than we expected however the staff were quick to move a few tables to accommodate us all without issue. We ordered the Gezi platter 3 for all of us, 6 platters in fact and the food was absolutely delicious! Everyone was super impressed. The meats were all soft and tender, very flavoursome and so much to go around. We ended up taking several take away boxes as we just could not finish it all there! My nephew is 3 and is allergic to egg, after ordering him some nuggets and chips we soon realised they were dipped in egg. The chef makes the nuggets in house, he quickly whipped up some chicken shish and it was a great hit with the kids! Plenty of warm bread to go around and they kept on replenishing the bread baskets, you certainly won’t ever leave hungry! A massive thank you to our waitress Anna, she looked after us so well and nothing was too much trouble. She really was fantastic and made us feel very welcome and valued as customers. Real service at its best, she is a real credit and it did not go unnoticed. I know sometimes such a large group like ours can be a bit of a handful, but she did not break a sweat and all with a smile on her face.   If you are thinking of visiting, don’t think twice. I know we will be back, was a great place for our celebrations and Gezi Park really was the perfect choice for us, I’m sure it will be for you too!

title: Terrific Turkish
comment: The Turkish hotspot of Wanstead, great range of drinks and even better food, watch out for Hassan one of the beat managers in Wanstead ensuring his staff provide excellent quality of service. Gezi Park is a must if you are passing through wanstead !!!

title: Gezi Park restaurant Wanstead
comment: disappointing food my lamb shank tasted boiled rather then oven cooked swimming in an acidic sauce soggy potatoes im sure it had been cooked earlier and microwaved . I did ask and answer was no ..friends fish she said was ok the other two said food was dry no one finished their meal .we had wine and other drinks I feel overpriced for the quality of the food,and the drinks probably priced same as other restaurants.. theres a good choice in Wanstead. i will avoid this place in future although the staff were good and no complaints about them .disappointing experience

title: Amazing food but lack of disabled facilities
comment: The food is great quality, meat was moist and delicious even the salad vinaigrette was so good. Staff are very friendly and helpful and the decor was lovely. Only thing from giving a 5 star was that it was extremely difficult getting my dad to the toilet since he is disabled and the toilet can only be accessed via stairs. I would suggest even getting another banister on the left to make it more accessible to others less able to walk as my dad does not have full mobility of his right arm and leg.

title: Great Turkish Restaurant!
comment: Visiting the area, this was a fantastic family find. Fabulous Turkish food and friendly staff. Would definitely return.

title: Great food, great service
comment: The staff are very friendly and welcoming. The food is really tasty. I recommend the prawns. The restaurant is clean and comfortable.

title: Gezi...Gezi...Gezi!
comment: Had a wonderful time, food was on point. Staff first wonderful! Large portions so make space in your fridge!

title: Another lovely meal
comment: Always try to visit here when we stay with our daughter in Wanstead. As usual, the food was excellent as are the staff

title: ...the Best...
comment: ...always was the best, still is, and always will be. If we could get the lamb chops delivered in Cornwall, we would do. Tender favoured meat that tastes sublime and melts in the mouth. Great value, great service.

title: My favourite Turkish restaurant in London!
comment: I have been coming to Gezi Park for around 4 years now and try to come at least once a month, more often if I can.  We love the Gezi platters as there is so much variety on offer. Service is great and always friendly Hassan and the staff. It is definitely our favourite Turkish restaurant in London.

title: Best
comment: Best kebab in the area! Friendly staff. Fresh bread, good quality meat, desserts and e salads . Taste food. Most importantly great owners who are always happy and welcoming. Recommend 100% :)

title: Best One in the town
comment: Great food, and excellent customer service. Will be coming back with friends next time again for sure. Thank you very much

title: Amazing
comment: From Door they deliver the best customer service, the food is always fresh, humus is the best in town :) the restaurant is beautiful inside out, can wait for the weather to get better to enjoy Some beers at their terrace.

title: It's okay
comment: The food taste really good the price wasn't bad. The ambiance was quite snug. The staff was friendly. My only disappointments were: the food portion was small and the salad wasn't the regular Turkish type salad. There was pommegranate in the salad and whilst I liked the look of it and I do like pommegranate, it's tough to eat it in a salad and have to spit the seeds out.

title: Quality!
comment: The atmosphere is always romantic and the staff and owner are continually welcoming. The starters and drinks are served quickly, even if the restaurant is completely full. I have tried a few of there main courses and the portions are very well sized and well cooked. I can't really talk about the desert as the starter and the main is so delicious that i never leave room for it ! They have just finished refurbishing their outside decking which looks very cool. I am looking forward to sitting out with my wife in the summer.

title: Perfect venue for romance
comment: Gezi Park has the perfect ambience for a couple's romantic evening,the turkish music,candles,friendly and welcoming waiting sfaff together with mouthwatering cuisine and wine have peruaded us to become enthusiastic regular visitors to Gezi ❤

title: Dinner
comment: Just had a lovely dinner here, its always great, i keep coming back they have realy good food and service.

title: Always great value and good food
comment: Love the £9.95 Lunch offer although I am not sure who eats the rice pudding and Barclava I am normally stuffed after 2 courses.

title: Unrivalled Experience
comment: As a former resident of Wanstead I used to often eat at Gezi park; and on my return to the area it was my number one choice for dinner. I have never had a bad meal at this restaurant; my only hard decision is deciding what to choose. Every meal starts with complimentary bread and dips (which they give to you after you've chosen your meal) - so be aware if you have small appetites. I usually opt for a Meze platter to start - both the hot and cold platters are sublime. The food is cooked authentically right in the heart of the restaurant with a glass window for all to see. As a frequent visitor to Turkey I can honestly say that the food is good, honest with and authentic with a slight European twist. The portions are hearty and there is never the notion of wanting more. I expect that the dessert menu is usually chosen - I have never got that far yet!

title: Perfect food :) perfect hosts
comment: We’ve been eating here for years & never had a bad meal. The food is delicious & all cooked fresh. The service is great & friendly. We’ve moved out of the area & still come back regularly to eat here :)

title: Catered for a group of 20 plus no problem
comment: We had a works retirement meal here in the week, early afternoon. We were all seated at the rear of the restaurant in a quiet area, the service was awesome as was the food, really really enjoyed the whole afternoon. We were all made very welcome by Hassan and his colleagues. I’ve eaten in various Turkish restaurants in Stoke Newington having worked there for many years, Gezi Park was as good if not better! Thank you for contributing and making the day a memorable one for our retired colleague!

title: Lovely dinner
comment: I have been there in dinner with my friend who is from Germany and we had lamb casserole and lamb shish it was lovely and we had complementary tea and dessert as well he was very thankful and the service was an excellent!!!

title: Simply the best!!!!!
comment: This one overtakes every other Turkish restaurant I have gone too by a mile. We ordered the platter for 2 and my goodness, the meat was succulent and the seasoning to die for. It was my first time to have lamb ribs (most Turkish do shish, lamb chops) the ribs were mouthwatering. No1 place!! my trip from central London was worth it. Oh nearly forgot, the service and team are the friendliest and happiest bunch in a very busy place!

title: Still the best Turkish food in east London...
comment: ...in our humble opinion. We've tried a number of Turkish restaurants in the area over the years. But we keep coming back to Gezi Park. The food is so fresh, much of it cooked over an open fire a few steps from your table. And the staff is unbelievably thoughtful and friendly -- the host in particular. We've never had an experience that was anything less than stellar.

title: Great food at good prices
comment: Came with colleagues for our Christmas celebrations. Polite and attentive staff. Really tasty food and generous portions. I had the prawn skewers and I couldn't believe how much I was given. Fresh and delicious. I like the huge fish tank!

title: Warm reception and lovely food!
comment: We’ve been coming to Gezi park regularly for almost two years now. The food is easily the best quality Turkish cuisine I’ve had in the area (and there is quite a lot of competition) but what puts Gezi Park above the rest is the service. Hassan and the waiting staff always make us feel special and looked after. If you’re after a place with a warm, family feel, this is the place for you.

title: Brilliant night
comment: Amazing Turkish restaurant in the middle of Wanstead. Staff are incredibly attentive, the food is good quality and it has a very good vibe. Been there three times and had the same brilliant each time. Highly recommended.

title: Fantastic Service... Average food!
comment: We came here after work on recommendation from a friend. We were greeted by the maître d who was very friendly and definitely added to the dining experience. The service was also very good from the outset, we had our daughter with us and we were provided with a high chair immediately. The restaurant definitely had a family friendly atmosphere. Unfortunately I found the food to just be average and a little more expensive than some of the other local turkish restaurants that have more flavoursome food.  I would go back because the restaurant was family friendly with good service.

title: Cold meze platter is the best!
comment: I am a fan of Turkish cuisine, and always in search for the best Turkish restaurants. I can confidently say that this place is one of the best places I have eaten at.. not only is the quality of the food good, but the service is amazing. We travelled 30 minutes to get here, and it’s our 2nd time here. Bon appetite ladies and gents!

title: Great
comment: Having eaten outside for lunch here a few times I finally made It in for an evening meal and couldn't have been happier. Great value, great service, great food.

title: ...the Best...
comment: ...always was the best, still is, and always will be. If we could get the lamb chops delivered in Cornwall, we would do. Tender favoured meat that tastes sublime and melts in the mouth. Great value, great service. The Best.

title: 10/10 Turkish... Staff, Service and food all amazing!!
comment: Me and my boyfriend come to Gezi Park every week! The food is always spot on! My favourite is the lamb sheesh, although on the odd occasion I get the sea bass and it is also really good! The service is always great and the staff are all so welcoming! It is also very reasonably priced! Gezi Park is the best Turkish restaurant I have been too! Thank you for always taking care of us! X

title: Dinner
comment: Great food, great service, I’m a regular in this restorant for sometime and will continue,  Thank you

title: Highly recommended amazing food service
comment: Very clean restaurant the staff is amazingly welcoming and helpful the food is always very tasteful and well presented

title: Excellent
comment: Had mix chicken and lamb sis kebab served with rice and salad. It was well cooked,absolutely tasty. Also turkish red wine perfectly comlemented with the dish. Our little daughter had turkish pizza and she was thrilled at the taste of it.  Gorgeous place excellent service, friendly staff at all times. 5 star hygiene rate restaurant.You feel like home.  We'll done to the chef.  We all had a wonderful Fathers day dinner. Thank you to the friendly owner of the restaurant Erdogan.

title: Delicioius, friendly and reasonably priced
comment: Gezi Park is a lovely, family-run Turkish restaurant. The staff are charming, and the food fresh and delicious. Their 3 course set lunch for £9.95 is excellent.

title: Great food at a great price
comment: I've been a handful of times and it's always lovely! The service is great - very attentive, they know the menu inside and out, they're happy to offer suggestions for what to eat or make amendments to dishes (I'm lactose intolerant), and the food always comes out quickly. They have a great lunch deal!

title: great food at a great price
comment: One of my favorites in Wanstead high street. The service is always great and welcoming. The food is good at a reasonable price. If you like turkish food, go there.

title: Very impressed
comment: Taking our clients out for an end of term lunch they were insistent we brought them here, travelling 30 miles to have a great meal Impressed by friendly staff on arrival we had a full choice of seating, whether it was inside or out and were seated very promptly The lunch menu is particularly good value, with a huge selection to choose from and plenty of things to tickle your tastebuds  The whole experience was great, in clean and modern surroundings and the feature fish tank inside is particularly impressive If you need a good place for a lovely lunch or dinner then make sure you come here! 10/10

title: Birthday Meal
comment: Visited Saturday early eve. We booked a table. The resturant was reasonably busy during our meal. The food was really good. We felt there could have been a little more rice on the plates but the meat was plentyful and very tender. Food being delivered to tables around us looked equallly as good as ours and gave us a few menu choice ideas for future visits. We ordered the little jug of lime cordial for £1.50 and received jugs of tap water so that we could dilute to our taste which was really nice to have as an option. Looking forward to our next visit. Thinking about trying the lunch deal too.

title: A most enjoyable dinner
comment: A very friendly welcome and an outdoor table set the scene for a very enjoyable dinner. Delicious bread and olives came while we were ordering, and the calamari and stuffed aubergine were perfect starters. We both enjoyed the mixed (chicken and lamb) sis, which came with rice and a salad. Everything was fresh and delicious, and the staff were warm and welcoming. Highly recommended.

title: Great casual dinner.
comment: We sat outside on a beautiful summer's night and had a delicious meal at this restaurant. We shared some dips and bread to start and also shared the Imam Bayildi with prawns, halloumi and salad. All the food was of a high standard and tasted amazing. We will definitely visit again.

title: Lovely traditional Turkish food!
comment: Great little Turkish restaurant with a good atmosphere. Lovely staff who are very accommodating and everything I've tried to date has been very tasty.

title: Very good Turkish food
comment: Visited on Friday night and the place was packed. We could sense the waiting staff were very busy when we arrived but we were seated after a few minutes and table service was efficient even though it was busy. The food and service were very good, definitely no room for dessert. The complementary olives could be bit nicer and maybe some hummus but otherwise everything was good.

title: Wonderful
comment: Maintains its game. Fabulous food: the lamb is exquisite and pomegranate tabulleh fresh as a daisy. Good value, great staff. Go.

title: Amazing food great costumer service
comment: Lovely atmosphere, delicious food and the costumer service it was amazing the name of the waitor was Hasan he was helpful with the menu and he really take care of us ....thank you guys we will definitely come back again

title: Excellent food and service
comment: We popped in on a Sunday evening. We were very pleased with our cold mixed mezze which was delicious and good value. The homemade bread is to die for. Highly recommended

title: Okay but food was too oily
comment: I came here with friends for a quick bite. We sat outside which is a great spot on a sunny day. The staff generally were very decent but there was one staff member that wasn't too friendly.  We ordered some meze and a salmon dish and asked for all of them to be brought out at the same time - the meze was brought first and the fish course 10 minutes later! The halloumi was on the salty side, the houmous was very nice, the aubergine dish we ordered was drenched in oil and the bread was drenched in oil. My friend enjoyed her fish course.  I wouldn't come here again. There are much better restaurants with better quality meze

title: Best Turkish restaurant in London
comment: I cannot speak highly enough of this place. The service is outstanding, the food is authentic, delicious and excellent value. I have lived in the area for a few months and already this has become one of my favourite restaurants in London. Superb takeaway service too. If they delivered it would be dangerous, according to my husband.

title: Shandy 28
comment: Really enjoyed our evening, the staff were very welcoming & friendly. The food was amazing especially the king prawns. My second visit but the first time for my family. Will definitely be going back.

title: Great and amazing Turkish food
comment: Highly recommended by me.pls do visit this place.so friendly customer service clean and neat.the fish tank is really beautiful.we ordered sharing platter worth for the money.food is so tasty,the bread and the dips are hot which really goes with the bread.trust me n do visit this place

title: Great restaurant
comment: Been here several times now. They have a great choice on the menu and it’s reasonably priced. Nice and pleasant service. You can also see the chefs cooking. Very good will definitely teturn

title: What a Gem of a Find!
comment: 27 people with 2 weeks notice? No problem! We just had a terrific 80th birthday party dinner here for 27. Food was amazingly good, and terrific value. I'm surprised some of us got past the starters, there was such a great choice. And the chocies were just as plentiful for the mains. The lamb was generously portioned and meltingly succulent. The fish was a delight for the birthday girl. Our veggies were suitably impressed by the stuffed aubergine and moussaka. Staff were attentive but unobtrusive and nothing was too much trouble. Beautiful breads, salads olives. problem was we were all too full for desserts, so will have to pop back another time for that experience too. Thank you for looking after us all so well.

title: Excellent food and service
comment: Me and my partner eat at this restaurant  Was very impressed with the lovely food and service was amazing  The meze was to die for  I had the special and I would definitely recommend this place.

title: Delicious food
comment: If you like delicious Turkish food look no further than this restaurant. The mains portions are very generous and my two daughters and I were very full on a sharing starter of dips with salad followed by two mains! Great atmosphere with good and friendly service too.

title: First time, won't be the last
comment: Went here on a Friday night? Reserved but a few spaces. Prompt service, extensive menu. Not cheap , but very tasty , Halep kebab was Great. Very clean toilets. Nice atmosphere , fish tank helped. Staff could have been a bit more friendly but they were busy. Overall a nice meal and will be back.

title: Trust the reviews!!
comment: The reviews are not wrong about this place! Delicious food, friendly service and you even get a few complimentary bits with your meal, always a winner! Will definitely be coming back! PS: Love the fish tank!

title: Great food
comment: This place offers great food and service at a very reasonable price. The only let down is the decor, the place is certainly due a full renovation. If you can see past that, it is certainly worth a visit.

title: The quality of the food is as good as always
comment: I came here with my friend a bit late, but that wasn't a problem. Having been here many times, we knew we were going to have a great dinner. We chose one of the big mezze platters, full of meat and rice. Delicious! We enjoyed the dinner with a Rioja Red Wine. Service was outstanding and friendly as always! The only complain is the music, a bit loud and more suitable for a club, in my opinion.

title: Fantastic
comment: On Friday night my friend and I went out for a bite to eat and a chat. GEZI PARK was perfect. The food was fantastic and the portions were huge.  The staff were all really friendly and attentive without being overwhelming.  GEZI PARK is an absolute must for families looking for a very unreasonably priced midweek treat or a weekend family occasion.  We most definitely will be back.

title: Excellent Lunch Set Menu
comment: I normally come here once a week to enjoy the excellent lunch menu that they provide from Monday to Friday for just £9.95. The menu has multiple choices for all the tastes. I have tried several starters and main dishes and they are all very tasty, and the portions are huge. They also give you bread with some dips, so you definitely don't leave the restaurant hungry! The staff is very well-trained by the owner, as they are all very polite, friendly and very efficient. See you soon.

title: Superb food
comment: The service and the food were excellent - and the staff made sure everyone had something great to eat including those who were vegetarian or had food intolerances.

title: Good value
comment: Food was fine. I'm sure there is better Turkish food out there, but I'm also sure there is a lot worse. The lunchtime set menu (£9.95 for actually 3 courses, though online the menu says 2 courses) is exceptionally good value in my opinion. Service was good, unobtrusive but timely, and the restaurant itself, décor wise, was okay. Toilets very clean and well appointed - always a positive sign in a restaurant, I think.  Additionally, a service charge was NOT automatically added to our bill. Payment for service (cash, or added to the card) was left up to us - an excellent practice, that I wish more restaurants adopted.

title: great service and value
comment: I have been a couple of times now and I would highly recommend. We came here last night and I must say the service was really good. My wife ordered something which she did not like the look of, however they offered to make something else for her at no extra cost which was very generous and much appreciated. The food is really good quality and the portions a good size, and all at a very decent price too. One of the best Turkish restaurants in the area, I would recommend.

title: Consistent food service and value
comment: We use this place quite frequently for its £9.95 lunch which is very good value, so far all our selections have been excellent

title: Great food!
comment: Good quality Turkish Restaurant with a wide choice of food. Friendly staff. Nice location. Reasonable prices.

title: Beautifully Marinated
comment: Whilst perusing the Christmas Market on Wanstead High St we were recommended this Turkish Restaurant so popped in for lunch. Although clearly popular with locals we managed to get a table and quickly decided the grilled platter for two sounded perfect. We were given complimentary flat breads with dips and olives which were lovely and took the edge off our hunger.Just as we finished the breads our platter of pork, chicken, koftas and chicken wings arrived on a bed of rice. The meat was marinated beautifully, tasted great and having soaked up the juices the rice complimented it well. With a side of fries and a green salad we couldn’t manage dessert and left agreeing how it had been one of the best Turkish meals we’d had.

title: Great restaurant for Nice food
comment: I have been there many times. All the mezes and main courses are really delicious. Every food is fresh. Service is very fast. You can enjoy your time in Gezi Park restaurant with your friends with their relaxing atmosphere. I strongly recommend lamb shish and lamb ribs.

title: Good quality food at good prices
comment: Had dinner with my wife here one evening.  Good quality food and reasonably priced. Nice level of service with a good atmosphere

title: Very nice Turkish restaurant
comment: About 20% cheaper than central London, this Wanstead High Street Restaurant has a good selection, keeping both Veggies and meat eaters satisfied.Lovely food. There is a large, well maintained fish-tank with beautiful fish to look at while waiting for you food. Fully licensed.

title: Strongly recommend
comment: Great food brilliant taste very friendly service would recommended Lamb shish very very much it will be the best you have ever tasted. Also I have to underline that prices are very reasonable comparing to other restaurants.

title: Good food, great service
comment: Popped in here at 3.30 as had been sales shopping and missed lunch. Olives, and dips brought up with hot bread, lovely. We both ordered the chicken shish which was superb, really succulent. I think this is a really good family run restuarant.

title: The best Turkish Restaurant in Essex!!!
comment: Thank you Gezi park for the lovely evening The food was Delicious full of flavour specially  Lamb Liver and KingPrawn Casserole which I had and even my wife was happy with the whole sea bass. Great food  Highly Recommend ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Fantastic Turkish Restaurant
comment: Great food cooked brilliantly, service was excellent. Take away available as well and is just as good.

title: ok but not that great
comment: didn't really enjoy the meal.this was properly 2 yrs ago but i guess maybe i will try the restaurant again one day .

title: NEVER ORDER TAKEAWAY
comment: It's with regret that I'm writing this, as I have had good food on the past. But as I usually always order takeaway I have found that more than half these times there are issues with my orders.  Usually its just a forgotten dish like bread or rice, which I can live with. But today I was waiting in the restaurant for more than 10 mins while my food was sitting on a table near the kitchen with no one checking to see if it was mine.  When I eventually got it and asked why no one checked the food, a waiter told me he didn't take the order on the phone and so it wasn't his fault. I said that's unprofessional as they're all from the same establishment, but she said he didn't care and blamed it on the chefs.  When I got home my food was cold and the portions were small.  I won't go there again, there are amazing Turkish restaurants on JustEat and Hungry House, plus they deliver!

title: Brilliant Restaurant
comment: The food is really tasty (the veggie mousakka and the mixed grill are especially recommended). The restaurant is nice inside and has some seating outside, if the weather permits. Also do takeaway which is equally good. Good price for quality.

title: Fantastic food
comment: Stopping local and just wandering around found this gem of a place. Food really good quality, top value for money and helpful pleasant staff and you could just tell from the moment i arrived they would go the extra mile to assist. The restaurant itself is really clean and I will definitely be back when in town.

title: Miserable waiter
comment: Visited on a warm evening and the restaurant was fairly busy with lots eating outside.  We sat inside - ordered starters and mains and bottle of wine. Reasonable price of £30 per head including tip.  The food was enjoyable however the experience was spoiled by a waiter who just looked really fed up and looked like he was enjoying his job. When 1 of my friends asked for an extra sauce he didn't even crack a smile.  I'm not saying I enjoy overbearing waiters however I thought a smile and asking 'if everything is okay' is normally common practice?  We nearly went to other Turkish restaurant - Otto - up the road but I'd suggested this one as I'd been a few times before. We will probably go there next time.

title: Amazing food
comment: We booked a table here. Wow what a fab place. We ordered a platter which had kebabs.. chicken wings.. chicken breast chunks..lamb cubes on a bed of rice and salad. Was lovely. Reasonably priced too. Lovely staff. Will deffo return next time we are down south.

title: Tasty Lamb Shish
comment: Have been numerous times before and last night was very enjoyable. A friendly welcome on arrival, served drinks and given menu without delay. Yakut house red wine most acceptable. Powerful chilli, olives, yoghurt dip and tasty flatbread brought to table whilst we waited (not long) for our food. Falafel crunchy to hard exterior, Kisir salad very tasty and fresh. Good portion of lamb in shish, guessing it must have been marinaded as well tender with excellent charring from the grill. (Hardworking grill station with efficient extraction). Rice moist with separate grains. Unexpected salad. Excellent meal, very good friendly service- will go again. Note to self: As a non-smoker I must remember to sit well within the room as sitting near the open door I could smell cigarette smoke from folks on the outside decking

title: good service
comment: I've been here once, the food was good, friendly stuff, nothing to complain. all good, I would recommend it

title: Terrible Service
comment: I'm a vegetarian and occasionally restaurants mix up their orders and serve me a meat variety of the vegetarian meal I've ordered. This is pretty upsetting but in my experience, the manager usually appears, apologises a lot and does everything possible to make the evening enjoyable, despite the fact they've just accidentally made me eat a mouthful of meat.  Sadly this was not the case at Gezi Park, the waiter said a rather half hearted sorry & then left me watching my friend eating during the long wait until my replacement meal arrived, which then came with the wrong side! He bought us some complimentary halloumi & salad to make up for this 2nd mistake, but we were charged the full amount on the bill & no one checked we'd enjoyed our meal or apologised again. I would never go back and would advise vegetarians to avoid!

title: Review of Gezi Park
comment: I came here midweek with some friends. I'd probably come again, bearing in mind I am vegetarian, the offerings were reasonable. My friends who had meat, said it was good and from what I saw it I'd probably say it looked better than the vegi I had. On the whole a good place to eat.

title: Lovely meal
comment: Went to this recently on 4th June had the hot meze to start contain calamari and cheese parcel thing and all different things had a small and it shared perfect between 2 there was 3 of us and also tried some of the Albanian liver.then for the main had the Gezi park palater of meat and rice for 3 people there was lots and lots of meat the rice was so nice and the bread given table at the start was so nice too.  Also had chips and salad with the main too.

title: Amazing, friendly service, and very tasty, delicious fresh Turkish food.
comment: My friend and I had a meal here last night, and I have to say, on my trip to London it has been the best meal out I've had.  The food really was superb and delicious, with complimentary hot breads and dips. I had the lamb casserole and my friend had the vegetable moussaka, both were prepared promptly and were well received by two hungry diners.  What really blew us away was the service in this restaurant - my friend recommended it as she lives in this area and has been many times - this was my first visit and what a delight it was. Sarah, one of the serving staff, was an absolute joy and really went above and beyond the call of duty! I lost a parking ticket and went to retrieve it after leaving, and she literally put her gloves on and rooted around the bins for me, and it was found, thankfully. I've been to many top restaurants In my life and I can safely say that Gezi Park is up there with the best in terms of service.  On top of all that, it's very friendly, welcoming, relaxed and inviting decor, and the food is genuinely delicious, plus it's very very reasonable in price.

title: Good value for money
comment: I came here on a Saturday for lunch as my friends from Spain wanted to try something different. I had been here a few times and never been disappointed, so I knew this place was a win. We had Falafel and Humous as starters, and then we chose different things like Kebab, Moussaka, Princess Casserole with some beers. The price was very cheap, something very rare in the area these days! The service was outstanding as always. Definitely coming back soon!

title: wow superb kind people and perfect food
comment: i really love their Kebabs, My friends also love their foods.I have been there nearly 6 times and I strongly recommend their salads and "kaburga (ribs)" kebabs. The owners and all the staff are superb kinds... enjoy..it is ideal or friends, families, business or couples because the design of the restaurant is unique and smile:) it is to one of the best Turkish and Mediterranean restaurants I ever been in the UK

title: Lovely restaurant
comment: I have been to this restaurant a good few times now and its amazing.. I would say best turkish place I have been to so far. The food is delicious, especially the lamb shish and the grilled prawns. Also the atmosphere and staff are all friendly and welcoming. I will definitely go back again soon..

title: I love this place!
comment: Gezi Park is defiantly the place to come to if you would love traditional Turkish food. I found this place about a year ago and I've never been disappointed. The customer service is amazing and all the staff are so friendly, I'm always greeted in seconds when walking in, which makes the atmosphere very pleasant to be in. There lahmacun and adana kofte is out of this world. I've been served by Sara on more then one occasion, and she's great and her job, very polite and efficient, but its the whole team that makes this place great.

title: Always A Treat
comment: Always a pleasure eating here whether solo or with friends. The food has never let me down and I believe I've only sat indoors once, always eating on the deck outside and people watching. The staff is always pleasant and the prices are reasonable.

title: Saturday night and still good service
comment: Ok the starters were very good and the service was pretty good I had the lamb casserole which was average but the other 3 of us had better food was told salad came with everything but it was a small salad  Reasonable prices and pretty good overall slightly better quality of food and you would get 5 stars

title: Amazing menu!
comment: Pari one of the Waitresses suggested me the menu! And it was amazing, nice two dishes for very good price!!! And my Son get some chicken and he enjoyed like me!!!! Good for a father single day!!!

title: Beutiful food
comment: I've been there already twice. And I'm sure I became regular. This place it's just great. Food is full of taste, you don't need anything else. Service is very polite, friendly and very.. quick.. sometimes too quick haha. Usually you can find this place as a busy and I'm not suprise.

title: standard turkish
comment: The seating make this much more of a restaurant with a seperate rear are carrying about 7 tables The only issue we found is the qualty of the chicken isn't notable neither is the small portions, but it doesn't pretend to be anything else

title: Review
comment: The food was fantastic and the staff were brilliant. I went on a Saturday afternoon around 16:00. I parked in the car park adjacent to Co Op supermarket. The price is very good too and I thoroughly recommend it to anybody considering it. It is clean and I ate Turkish food as they sell food from other countries.

title: Very good
comment: A good Turkish restaurant in Wanstead - tasty & succulent meats, lovely fresh bread and salads...basically what you would expect of a Turkish restaurant! Would happily return - Wanstead is a nice area too.

title: We eat here once a week at least!!
comment: Excellent food, always go for the chicken shish kebab, juicy and tender.  excellent staff, reasonably priced! You get all the added extras as you would expect from a meze- always eat more than we wanted to and come out absolutely full to the brim. Come here at least once a week. Love it!

title: Great grilled meats
comment: We go here regularly if I want a bit of a meat feast. The staff are polite and friendly, service is normally quick and efficient. I normally have the same thing, mixed grill and lamb chops. The meat is always superbly cooked, the lamb in particular is outstanding. The sides, e.g. variety of salads, hummus, Turkish bread, chilli sauce are also excellent, and the Turkish house wine is also decent. Possibly not the cheapest, but is still value for money, as the portions are a good size. I normally order too much, and take the remainder with me for breakfast the following day.

title: AWESOME!
comment: thank you so much for everything guys! it was just awesome!  amazing food and the environment is so cozy and the best place to stay in after a hard day at work.  I was really surprised about the professionalism from staff even on busiest times.  I will recommend this place to anyone who wants to spend theirs free short time after work and time off.

title: Stunning birthday dinner
comment: I decided to ask Gezi Park to host our mum's 80th dinner and it was one of my better decisions: the care and attention by Charlie, Sara, Hussein and the other staff was second to none and their welcome and warmth very touching. They helped us to decorate our private space and attended to our every need, including table layout, decoration, music and specific dietary needs. The food, as ever, was plentiful and magnificent, and the suggested wine worked beautifully with the yummy dishes. All our guests pronounced the night a great success! Thanks so much again to the team - we will be back!

title: Fantastic food, service and atmosphere!
comment: Been to Gezi Park numerous times over the past few years and have always been delighted about the food, service and atmosphere.  Luckily for me I can walk to the restaurant from home however I would happily travel if I had to! I would recommend this restaurant for meals with mates, family and with partners, as well as the occasional take away which are just as good.  Also, great portion sizes! Always go home full! Thanks guys!

title: Best Turkish food around
comment: Absolutely love this place. The food is tasty, the portions are great and I don't know how they do it but the accompanying salads are delicious. And, I'm not a big fan of Turkish food, generally it's just meat and rice but these guys go out of there way to impress.

title: Not so good
comment: We have visited a few times before as we enjoy Turkish food. Not a good experience this time. Service was friendly but patchy as 2 very large and noisy parties arrived. Food was hit and miss. the misses were a cold Turkish pizza and a seriously stale salad with putrid red cabbage that I couldnt even swallow accompanied by a rock hard old quarter of lemon that had turned brown. Mixed meze were like Iceland foods freezer selection. Its a cheap place no doubt but we will not return. There are now so many amazing places to eat in Wanstead that this is not in contention.

title: Great Hummus
comment: The hummus was excellent and the service very friendly. Rest of the meal was pretty good as well. Nice evening out on the patio.

title: Good value lunch
comment: Visited with a friend for a lunch on lovely sunny day. The set lunch menu for 2 courses was great value. I had pide for starter and chicken beyti for main. Both were delicious and served quickly and pipping hot. With a soft drink worked out at £10 excellent value.

title: Tasty and lots of it!
comment: I'm not usually a fan of Turkish food but at a business dinner I could not fault the food here. We had vegetarian starters of numerous sharing plates which included some feta parcels in filo pastry which were utterly delicious. Most had chicken or lamb for main courses and were pleased with their dishes - I had fish which was perfectly cooked. The service was excellent. We weren't rushed despite it being a busy a Friday evening. There's a good feel in the restaurant- it's casual; there were also a few loan diners who seems very content.

title: EXCELLENT
comment: Had lunch here today after awful experience in The Cuckfield, two door down. Had a lovely lunch and staff were excellent, they even provide free food for homeless people which was lovely to see.

title: Excellent service great food
comment: We had a mix of starters and kebabs for main , everything was really good. Great taste, lots of options, really good service. I would definitely go back.

title: great local restaurant
comment: Eat from Gezi Park regularly, either take away or inside. Staff are great, really friendly food is always excellent, haven't got a bad word to say about them. Now they have a banner saying free food for homeless people, so they are involved in charitable acts which makes them even better in my opinion. The Mousakka is my good, all kebabs tasty and the bread is fantastic.

title: Late night feast
comment: Called in very late with some friends just arrived from France ... it was really finished for the night, yet we were made welcome, served delicious food ... all with a smile!  First class service AND delicious food!

title: Good food
comment: GREat value and really good. I especially recommend the lamb shish. Staff are really friendly. Service was good. Worth a try!

title: Good value mezzes - friendly
comment: Saturday lunch time so only a handful of people in what is quite a large restaurant. Good mixed hot mezzes to share and decent house wine. Service friendly and efficient. Patio outside front would be great on a warm sunny day - people watching on the busy high street!

title: Meze
comment: Can't beat this place on quality or quantity in Wanstead. Defo try the calamari and the meze meatfests.

title: amazing food and wonderful service
comment: Gezi park is definitely one of the best turkish restaurants i've been to, they have a good service with kind staff and delicious food. All in one. what more can a customer ask for? i highly recommend gezi park for everyone. it's the best place for birthdays, friends and family meals.

title: The best Turkish food in London!
comment: My colleague is turkish and he took me and some other girls for what he called "heavenly lamb ribs." I used to live near finsbury park where there is a big turkish community and hence many restaurants which i thought were really good. But after tonight it has totally changed and I loved every bit of all the dishes they served whole heartedly.  Succulent lamb ribs that had a lot to bite on, fresh salad, bread was sprinkled with oil and they also served really spicy turkish Chilly I loved so much. Service was great, they constantly checked on us and everything was presented nicely and the restaurant was clean. Good ventilation so its authentic charcoal grill didn't soak your clothes with bbq fumes.  What's more, I was never into turkish sweets as they normally come soaked in sugar/honey syrup but this one was different and i recommend everyone to try for sure. My colleague said it's home made style and they make it on the premise and it's very hard to come by in London. I had a great night with gorgeous food. If I lived close by i'd definitely come every week!

title: A good reason to visit Wanstead
comment: We've been to Gezi Park more than a dozen times over the past two years, and the experience is so consistently excellent that we're ashamed for not having written a review yet. This is one of a few great restaurants on the Wanstead High Street, but if you're seeking excellent Turkish in London, it's well worth the tube fare to E11. A versatile menu, expertise behind the grill and thoughtful service make this place unique. It's also great value.  Before any of the dishes arrive, there's fresh pita with olives and sauces -- the chilli sauce is just the right kind of spicy. The salad is always pleasantly surprising. Try the halloumi and sucuk and the albanian liver if that's your speed, but the mezze menu is extensive with plenty of tamer options. The kebabs are a lot of food for a couple -- we usually order one meat and one vegetarian dish. My mouth is literally watering as I think of the lamb. We're not into dessert, and yet we always order the baklava.  The hard-working staff are friendly and accommodating, although I can't imagine needing anything that isn't happily given already. Many months ago, we once watched a troublesome table hassle the waiter for something that was their own fault. I mention this only because the waiter and manager responded with impeccable grace. I was already sold on the food, but it was nice to catch a glimpse of the character of the business.  Gezi Park got deservedly busier after winning the Guardian Food Awards, so call for a table. Early in the night tends to be a better bet for a walk-in meal.

title: Birthday meal
comment: Lovely resturant. amazing food cooked beautifully. gorgeous settings. will defo be coming here again. Food was reasonably priced too. yum!

title: Excellent service, comprehensive menu
comment: I love how cozy and welcoming the place is. It's in a quite posh area and it definitely meets the standards. Lovely fish tank that completes the relaxing atmosphere. Plenty of vegetarian dishes to choose from, too. The food is delicious, the prices accessible and the staff are very polite and professional.

title: Great food and service!
comment: Great food and great service. Starters were fab (had the mix cold starters) and the main was the yoghurt kofte which I would reccommend. Would definitely go back there!

title: Lamb chops to die for!
comment: Outstanding lamb chops; don't be a chump and order moussaka, you MUST try the lamp chops. It's about £25 a head with wine and the main courses are enormous; it's not necessary to order starters too.

title: disappointing
comment: Arranged an evening meal with good friends at Gezi in Wanstead . The food was average if not below. However, worst of all staff was dead keen to ensure quick turnover following the EAT AND LEAVE motto. Never again!!!

title: Fantastic sea bass
comment: We sat on the terrace one warm Friday evening a couple of weeks ago. We ordered a sea bass, a sword fish, a glass of yakut Turkish wine and a beer. A couple of minutes later some hot turkish bread and dips arrived. I love that Turkish restaurants still give you freebies, when so many restaurants charge for every last crumb now. The sea bass was fantastic. Large, fresh and with a crispy griddled skin. Delicious. My partner's swordfish was equally lovely. Service very pleasant. Highly recommended.

title: Chicken Wings are Fab!!!
comment: I use this place time to time for a quick take away. Food is absolutely amazing. Chicken wings or lamb chops they are both equally delicious. Love this place.

title: A must visit!
comment: Sat outside on a beautiful day with a nice view of the park to my left. The staff were all very friendly, professional and attentive. Food tasted absolutely delicious and the speed at which the food came out was really pleasing! The adana kofte large was juicy, well flavoured and overall, very tasty! The side salad accompanying the dish was such a good portion, it could have been served as a main in many other places. The constant top up of sauces and bread without request was excellent! The bill for two came to £21.50 and was worth every penny! Also, try their scrumptious Turkish pizza!

title: Excellent Turkish Cuisine
comment: Good quality food well cooked. Attentive service. Share a starter platter if you want room for your main. Very pleasant Turkish wines to go with the food.

title: Average over priced food
comment: First and last visit unfortunately. Food was bland and very over priced in comparison to other Turkish restaurants I have visited. I had lamb chops. £15.95 for 4! Very dry, bland and no taste. Was not impressed at all. Starters were ok. Bread and dips. Wine was £18 for bottle of Pinot Grigio. Omg the cheapest nastiest wine ever. So acidic...... no name brand just a cheap £3 bottle selling for £18 if you ask me. Staff nice. Also nice that you can sit outside. But for me the food was disappointing.

title: Great food and service
comment: Lovely fresh food, a great selection and the best chilli sauce and bread. The staff here are just so friendly you feel like they're friends. I love the fact that the food is cooked in front of you so you can see how fresh it is. Highly recommend.

title: Funeral Wake
comment: We were looking for somewhere different to hold my Mother-In-Laws wake, something different to a pub with sandwiches and crisps. We wanted a relaxed place for reflection, time for the family to get together and chat about their good memories, no where noisy or intrusive. Gezi Park really did us proud. We were unsure of the numbers that would attend the wake so had to estimate. On the day, we had fewer people than we estimated, this was no issue. The food was great, in fact it was perfect. The staff were most welcoming and accommodating. Even doggie bags to go were no issue. Gezi Park did us proud, no disappointments at all and we are so pleased we close this venue. Thank you to all the staff that made that day a perfect ending, a day never to be forgotten, memorable forever. .

title: Not the best Turkish place at all
comment: Group of 20...Had a good time with our friends, but as for the food, VERY disappointed...the cold and hot meze was not up to scratch, hot consisted of what I'm sure was mostly frozen Iceland food, deep fried! Some veggie samosa, spring roll and maybe one piece of calamari, amongst some other small veggie items! HARDLY impressive. The main again was not at all impressive, was expecting a lot more food. The price agreed was to be £14pp ALL IN. This was fobbed off at the last minute when the sneaky service charges were added...VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!! Had a very similar meal about a month prior (Soray Sofrasi, Gants Hill) payed £12pp, got a lot more food, better service, and NO sneaky charges added to the bottom of the bill. Please avoid this place, get yourself some proper Turkish food in you and go elsewhere.

title: Good Food
comment: I enjoyed the mixed appetizers and Mediterranean olives more than my entree. For my entree, I ordered the lamb shish. It was seasoned/marinated very well, but the lamb was very fatty. I did not find a good piece of meat on my plate. I also tasted the chicken wings. It was also well seasoned/marinated, and contained more meat than the lamb. For dessert, I ordered the chocolate fondant cake. I was very disappointed. It tasted like a slice of cake you can get from the local grocery store. For some reason, I expected the dessert to be better than the main course, yet it wasn’t. It was ice cold (almost like ice cream), which made it seem like it wasn't "homemade"; I could not taste the yummy, both healthy and unhealthy, ingredients that a standard chocolate cake contains since it had been sitting in a fridge most of the day. However, I would recommend this restaurant. The well-decorated interior is very inviting, and the food overall caters to and satisfies one’s taste buds.

title: Fresh and tasty food
comment: Great food, friendly service & reasonable prices. Choice of meat and veggy only based dishes. I will definitely return her when opportunity arise.

title: Gezi park restaurant
comment: Good customer service.  I tried chicken shish with yoghurt and it was good, althought the bread underneath was a little bit hard.  For the rest, everything was fine. Recomended

title: Awesome place !! Awesome food & prices!!
comment: We was looking for a reetaurant where i can see vegetarian menu, and also with food hygiene rate mininum 4 stars. We've been welcome by really nice staff and helpfull with us! Good service from staff and knowledge about menu. Environmental impact was sparkling well presented. Wifi connections, massive fish tank, well presented plaiting well trained staff. I will go there any time again. Strongly recommend for anyone any time.  Love it!

title: The best chilli sauce ever!
comment: I prefer Gezi Park over Otto. There I said it. Why? Because the customer service is great, I can see them cook my food, the bread is beautiful and the meat cooked is fantastic. There's a nice atmosphere, there is always a table available and very reasonably priced.  Go there people of Wanstead, it's not Green Lanes but the closest we'll get.

title: Fun
comment: Had a meal with my nan, mum uncle, aunt and wife.  Good staff. Tasty food. Great lunchtime value. Memorable..

title: We were the last to leave!
comment: My friend and I went there for dinner in April as a last minute decision and we were so glad we did! Having visited there once in the summer at least a couple of years ago and I would say, there was nothing special about it. But so much has changed since then!!! The quality and standard has gone up quite a few notches! The food was absolutely delicious, large portions and beautifully presented. The staff were very friendly and accommodating and couldn't do enough to ensure we had a good experience there. Perfect choice of wine recommendation too! I have visited Otto's many times but this is absolutely my favourite choice now, because the food is far better, the staff are most definitely friendlier and the value excellent.  We had such a lovely time that my friend and I were the last one's there but we didn't realise this and at no time were we made to feel we had to leave. Thank you Gezi Park for a fabulous evening, I look forward to returning soon.

title: Delicious grilled meats
comment: We have eaten here many times and the grilled meats are delicious, in particular the lamb kebabs and chops. The staff are very friendly and attentive.

title: Great food!
comment: Popped in here for their 2 course lunch - huge portions, great service and delicious food. This was recommended to me by a friend and was definitely worth it.

title: Excellent service amazing food
comment: I had been with my friend's. Staff was friendly and smiling. Food was excellent perfect.I never eat this kind of meat. Thank you gezi park

title: Great Find
comment: Found this while on a short break in London What a find, great Turkish food Enjoyed every mouth full, and there were plenty of them. Service great,food excellent, bill very reasonable If you are anywhere near try this place

title: Never disappoints!
comment: Food here is always good.. Never had a bad meal and I have been well over 10 times. The kebabs always come with plenty of meat, rice and salad.. Plus free bread and dips when you arrive. Chicken beyti has become a new favourite and the baklava is out of this world!!

title: Delicious meal!
comment: Enjoyed a very tasty and beautifully cooked meal. I have lost count at the times I have visited this little gem. Lovely attentive and polite staff. Food is served and presented in a very appetising way. Good friendly atmosphere and look forward to visiting again very soon.

title: Good for lunch
comment: Went here for late lunch. The food was ok. Flavours were ok but a bit lacking in seasoning. The waiter didn't really seem to understand what Gluten Free meant when asked and consequently we were served the kebab on pitta. We pointed this out and a more attentive waitress took control and brought us a new dish so no harm done.

title: Love it here
comment: Have been 3-4 times and never disappointed. The fresh Turkish food is delicious and great service. It's a quiet place, not the most busy and popular in wanstead but that also makes it charming for a low key lunch or dinner.  The bread is delicious as are the lamb (grill) dishes. Portions are very generous and we usually end up taking some leftovers home.

title: Excellent
comment: Went with my daughter and her fiancé We had a fabulous meal it was X absolutely delicious and will definitely go back when next in London.  We ordered too much but still pleasantly surprised with the bill. Great value for money

title: great local restaurant
comment: I've eaten here quite a few times over the the last year and it's been consistently good. The food is great, fresh and tasty. There's a great choice, including healthier options and vegetarian choices. The portions are huge, always come away with a doggy bag! Staff are lovely, always a warm welcome and the restaurant has a relaxing feel, very laid back.  The prices are a little high but willing to pay for good quality and convenience of location.

title: Amazing food and amazing service
comment: I ordered mixed plater for my family.I like lamb sis and lamb kofte is very tasty and atmosphere is very nice.

title: Highly Recommended
comment: This was my first visit, but it will not be my last. Had a family lunch here, the service was 1st class, staff really friendly, but most importantly, the food was wonderful. Highly recommend.

title: Love this place
comment: Great food, wine and atmosphere. This place is a must visit of you live in the East London area.  The chicken Shesh is very yummy.

title: Take away lunch
comment: Had a wrap for lunch from here hulloumi it was lovely good size it comes with salad in it too  Really recommend it

title: good food, genenours portions
comment: Like : nice place  very generous portions good quality plenty of choice on the menu . Dislike : ladies working there are quite rude 10£ menu deal is not available on weekends

title: Good Turkish restaurant
comment: Enjoyed a meal here last night on a night out with a friend.  Staff welcoming and friendly, very good service. Food good quality, typical Turkish.  Yes there are a few cheaper Turkish restaurants as some have pointed out, but it really wasn't overpriced.  Only small negative is the main was served a couple of minutes after we finished the starter, would have liked a breathing space. Would not put us off going again

title: Over charged for drinks food of poor standard
comment: There are a lot of nicer Turkish restaurants this is very poor standard of food chops full of fat jug of Pimms £20.00 just made 3 glasses would like a response

title: Stunning food and great service
comment: The food here is some of the best meze around, generous portions, everything done to perfection and the staff are really friendly, I can't speak higher of this place

title: Excellent service amazing food
comment: The service provided was excellent really good communication skill with costumers. The food was amazing highly recommended.

title: Nice
comment: Nice people and nice atmosphere food is always fresh, reasonably priced and great portions. Coban salad was fantastic thanks guys

title: Fantastic Food
comment: We were very impressed with the quality of food at Gezi Park. I recommend the swordfish shish, it was clearly the best sword fish I have ever tasted world wide.

title: Turkish Gem in Wanstead E11
comment: Way too long since last visit and review. Lovely welcome, and everything as it should be. Excellent all round. Very good. Lovely.

title: Tasty turkish
comment: Everything was to a good standard in this place. The friendly attentive family atmosphere, the visible Kebabs sizzling over the charcoal grill, the colourful lively fish in the fish tank. The place has character and is well popular. The starters were very tasty and the lamb and aubergine was delicious, albeit a bit on the greasy side. The Turkish coffee rounded it off very nicely thank you.

title: Our new find
comment: Had a nice evening out here with my wife and we both thoroughly enjoyed it. Had the lamb ribs and iskender both were delicious. Service was friendly and warm. Will definitely recommend and will be returning very soon.

title: Great Turkish food
