comment: I was there Last week with friends, had a lamb shish , it was soft and tender plus juicy which i like the most. And had baklava after loved it too...  They have a nice front decking with a lovely view of the park... Wide range of drinks as well.  Overall nice to be there...

title: Just OK
comment: Ive been to many Turkish Restaurants, but for me, this was a bit overpriced. It looked nice inside and out but there prices are about £5-7 more than average restaurants. When the food arrived the portions were very small, compared to other Turkish restaurants. The staff did not welcome there customers and did not communicate much with anyone, which I found a bit of a let down. The card machine did not work so we had to go to a cash machine but I felt a bit uncomfortable. There was no atmosphere and we were sat by a drafty window. It was not the worst restaurant but I would not go back, I would rather sit in McDonalds. Liven up the place, smile a bit more and look like you want customers, is my suggestion.

title: Amazing Restaurant
comment: Very good service and friendly staff. Atmosphere is perfect. I've had lamb shish and chicken shish. Very well cooked and just the way I want it.

title: Amazing mixed grill
comment: The food is wonderful. Olives and chilli/garlic dip are provided as a starter. There are some decent wines on the menu. Probably the best charcoal grill in the area. The lamb, kofte and chicken are all delicious. The salads that accompany the meats are excellent and unexpected, thought has gone into them. And it comes with rice and bread. Service is friendly, although when it's busy it can understandably be a little slow. Looking forward to going back!

title: Thank you
comment: Everything is very nice and delicious, the staff friendly and polite. service was good, food portions are big enough and satisfying. the venue is very nice and cheap prices

title: 5 Stars!!
comment: The food is excellent whether you are eating in or taking away! If you have the time I would suggest to eat in! The staff were lovely and the food was fantastic! Especially the lamb chops and the Sutlac rice pudding!

title: Lovely food and friendly staff
comment: We, friends from work, have been here a few times. The food is lovely, especially the starter platters. Prices are reasonable and the staff are very helpful. The service is quick enough for a lunch hour but not rushed if you want to take longer. Have been there in the evening once and the standard was just as good.

title: Great vibe, lovely staff, well-prepared Turkish fare
comment: Caught up with some friends at this lovely little Restaurant in smart Wanstead high street. The restaurant is fronted by a nice patio area that overlooks a park. Great for a cup of tea or a beer. Inside the decor is homely with a nice mural of Göreme and a fish tank.  The staff are great and friendly. The food was timely as cooked to perfection. Grilled meats are cooked there and then on display. The mezes are lovely, especially the aubergine dish, and served with the most perfect bread. For the main I had the slow cooked lamb shank, which fell of the bone and which I was able to eat with a spoon, it was so tender! Gorgeous. Prices slightly high for Turkish food but not unreasonable. Given the entire package I would say that it's one of the better Turkish restaurants I've been to in London and there are many!

title: The best turkish food in london
comment: The service it was perfect  The atmosphere amazing the food delicious we had the jumbo platter everything especially hasan was friendly and kind thank you for everything it was amazinggggggggggggg defently we will come back .. recommended for everyoneeeèe

title: Perfect!!!
comment: Amazing food anazing location with lovely friendly staff! I was let down by next door oriental chef had hair in the food and took the food back and saw this Gezi park and went inside to get something from there. They were very welcoming and totally.exeeded my expectations!

title: Good Turkish Takeaway
comment: We live just round the corner and have been using Gezi Park as our preferred Turkish takeaway ever since.  Go for their grilled meat options, which are all very good. Their lamb beyti is particularly delicious. I'm also a fan of their freshly grilled Turkish bread, and which is prepared to order. Warm and savoury from the grill, it's a real treat.  The basics are all there, and they're really good. I wish that they would put as much effort into their mezze as their meat, which still lags behind competitors like Mangal 2 in Hackney.  More thought into other sections of the menu and some homemade authentic Turkish desserts and this place would be a real gem. At the moment, it's a diamond in the rough.

title: Review
comment: The service was excellent. They make you feel special. I don't usually enjoy fresh Tuna but I decide to take a chance. I was glad I did as it was the best I have ever tasted.

title: Very bad take away
comment: Tried this place again as it was the only one still open. Had a baby chicken dish that was so over cooked and dry it was inedible. Had chicken wings which consisted of a few cheap mid section wings and no drumettes, the rice was a tiny portion, stone cold and the salad similarly a miserly portion of well past it's best soggy limp leaves soaked in that ghastly pomegranate juice which I asked them not to put on. With a couple of other bits that I ordered (many places give you a dish or two free) the bill came to over thirty pounds which was terrible value for money. I won't be going back again,

title: Nice meal out
comment: Very good service. Food excellent, we enjoyed mixed cold meze, lamb casserole and wonderfully creamy princess chicken

title: Excellent experience at Gezi Park in Wanstead
comment: I received a warm welcome when I arrived at the restaurant to sit down, I was offered to sit outside in the sun - it was awesome! I was offered a cool drink to go alongside straight away! The staff are extremely friendly, always making sure we had enough! The staff always ask how we are and that is a great touch. The food is AMAZING! Lots a variety from chicken to veg and all cooked to perfection. It is definitely the best place to eat in the area and can't wait to go back! I would highly recommend the service, experience and the food to anyone! Thanks Gezi Park! :)

title: Foods deffo Amazing
comment: The food is definitely worth a try. 5 stars to the 2 Turkish chefs behind... Nice restaurant thought bit pricey. Had a bit of service issues but then, its not an upmarket posh restaurant so no high expectations!! Worth a try for sure...

title: Very Disappointing
comment: We went for dinner last night. It was our first time in this restaurant and we had been quite keen to try it. I don't think we'll be going back. The food was poor - poor quality, lacked flavour, not very well prepared (poorly prepared minced lamb with bits of bone and grizzle throughout) and everything was just badly presented. I have had better food from takeaway outlets. As for the service, well I have been in cafes that have provided a better level of service.

title: Miss Rachel Hunt
comment: I visited this restaurant with friends. The food, service and atmosphere was superb. We usually go to shish in Chigwell but this restaurant food was the best Turkish food I have ever had. The prices were so reasonable and the quality of food was excellent. Can't wait to go back with my family and friends. Thank you to the staff for a most enjoyable evening

title: excelllent servedd
comment: I went to Gezi Park last night with my friends,we ate yoghurt with lamb it was absolutely fabulous. The waiter was really friendly and fast. i cant wait to go there again with my family.

title: Dadas
comment: Excellent food, excellent service, Pearl of Wanstead we need that type of class restaurant in our aera. Highly recommended place for every out goers.

title: Amazing food
comment: I moved to live into Wanstead a few months and this is one of my favourite restaurants. Food is always fresh and perfectly cooked, simply amazing.

title: Average Turkish But could be Better
comment: The restaurant has a nice feel and is clean. Four of us had lunch here. The service was good but the main meal came before we had finished the starters which was not nice since the restaurant was empty during lunch and there is no need for it. Out of the four starters only the falafel and the calamari were nice. The main meals were fairly ordinary with limp salad and tasteless rice.  Parking is available on the road

title: delish
comment: Service was always great, what I always look for is a clean restaurant and this was clean and hygienic. Always come back here.

title: Very good Turkish kitchen ever !!
comment: I was in gezi park restaurant on father's day with my family for dinner We had big plate to share (gezi special 3 i highly recommend to everybody ) it was nicely cooked and served. compliments to cheffs by the way price was also reasonable for fathers' s day we will definitely be back guys

title: Perfect restaurant
comment: I have been to this restaurant couple of times. I think its one of the best ones i have been to. Amazing food. Friendly staff very good customer service. I have had take away from this restaurant as well that was quality as well. Nice price as well. Definitely recommend it to everyone.

title: One of the best restaurant!!!
comment: I have been to this restaurant couple of times with my friends. I think its one of the best turkish restaurants that I have been to. The food was amazing!! the staff was very Friendly and very good customer service. Definitely recommend it to everyone.

title: 18th birthday celebrations
comment: Absolutely WOW went here with a group of 16 on Saturday for my daughters 18th birthday celebrations including four little kiddies, service fantastic,great friendly staff and the food was fantastic !!definitely worth a visit .  Great night had by all

title: Spot on!
comment: Great food, nicely spaced tables. Efficient and friendly service. Entertaining fish tank! Price is reasonable in relation to the area and nice added extras like watermelon.

title: Amazing food
comment: It was my second time visiting gezi park the food and the stuff was so great like the last time i was there with my five other friends two of my friend had a sea bass and four of us had mix kebab and some starters and the bill was very resonble best turkish we ever had i recomend it too every one who wants too visit this place.

title: Turkish Gem in Wanstead E11
comment: Another very , very good meal at Gezi with friends and family. Meat is amazing and Eddie and Julya hosts with the mosts. Great buzz.

title: Lovely restuarant.
comment: Such a lovely restuarant with very helpful and friendly staff. The food is to great standard and i would recommend people to try it out hope you enjoy it as much as i do!!

title: Does not disappoint...
comment: Fund this place a few months ago, and after visiting some of the other Turkish grills in and around the area, decided to give this place a go. food is amazing, as i often tend to go with a group, we always go for the mixed grill platters, and tastes much better than most of the other places in the area. Service is really good (have not had any reason to complain), and try their best to accommodate requests. table needs to e reserved particularly on Saturdays. if these guys did delivery, that would be amazing!!!

title: Brilliant on Every Level
comment: We just wanted somewhere to grab a very late lunch on the way home, as we were starving, and driving past, saw it was still open. The pleasant waitress confirmed they were still serving lunch, and pointed out the lunch offer. 2 courses: £7.95, or 3 for £9.95. This turned out to be incredible value, when we got our food, as the quality and size of dishes was much higher than you would guess for that price. We opted for the 2 courses, and chose different dishes, so we could share. I had a glass of wine from the very reasonably priced wine list, and when asking for a glass of tap water, was given a whole jug, with ice, mint and lemon. Way beyond the call of duty! The food came quickly, but not suspiciously so, and everything we chose was delicious, especially Mucver, a courgette croquette dish, which we had never heard of before. The waiter charmingly told us what herbs were used, when we asked about it. We also loved the green bean starter, Yesil Fasulye. The toilets were also spotlessly clean, though for those with disabilities, they are downstairs, and could be a struggle. We were absolutely delighted with the whole experience, and will definitely be back.

title: Gezi park restsurant
comment: This restaurant is da worst turkish restaurant i have ever been to. da lamb rib was like chewing gum, da chips were massive da meat was burnt da rice was bland da dips were shockingly boring they served me and my kids hot hot chilli sauce and a small garlic sauce for 5 ppl, the staff were rude da manager was flirting with the male customers and didnt attend to us at all. Please please AVOID IF U CAN NOT CHILD FRIENDLY

title: Not a foot wrong...
comment: The most delicious authentic Turkish food to be had in town. Taste, presentation and portions exceptional, and service charming and attentive. Nothing too much for the team, and will be back. Book though...we just got in, and a very pleasurable experience. Highly recommended.

title: Perfect :)
comment: I have been here for a meal with my girlfriend, although it was busy, they managed to find us a table within minutes. We had calamari and halloumi for starters followed by lamb chops and lamb shish. The lamb was probably the best I have had in a long while. Service was also very friendly and efficient. Will definitely return soon. Well worth a visit

title: Very pleasant
comment: I have visited here for the first time with my wife and 2 little girls, we have enjoyed the meals throughout, my children and we were made to feel very welcomed which made it even better. They have a beautiful fish tank which grabbed the attention of the kids. The meat were very tasty and cooked to perfection. Overall we were very please And will return without doubt

title: Avoid busy Saturday nights and avoid the fish!
comment: We went on a Saturday evening at the end of April and were shown to a table behind the large fish tank. We were out of site of the staff, and out of mind. It took ages to order drinks and for dips and starters to arrive. Other tables which were occupied after we sat down were served well before us. Our second bottle of wine never arrived, though to be fair wasn't added to the bill either. Staff ran in with plates of food, whacked them down and scuttled off, impossible to catch anyone's eye. My main course of salmon cost £15 and was served with anaemic chips and a boring side salad. It was a thin tail portion, really not suited to grilling, and was overcooked, leathery and uneatable. No-one came to check on us while we were eating and by the time the plates were cleared, we just wanted to leave. The chopped fruit served alongside the bill was good though. I've had good lunches here before, and it's a shame that the standard of service and food just can't be maintained on a busy Saturday evening.

title: Very busy, & noisey
comment: We did not book & for a Saturday night they told us to return in 30 minutes & they had a table for 4 ready. Had a lovely cold meze starter which sorted us out. I had a shish & it was very nice. others all had Kleftico but instead of Lamb shank it was shoulder. It was a good evening with a few drinks about £60 a couple.

title: Better turkish than in turkey!
comment: So glad this is on my high street! The bread that they serve here is LUSH! The mains have never let me down, all taste yummy. Very good and friendly service. And dare i say the Turkish food in this restaurant is better than what I had in Istanbul? There i said it!

title: Home away from home
comment: Visited this place for the first time and i must admit i was pretty much amazed. Me and my wife with our little girl decided to visit here after reading the positive reviews and made the perfect choice. We had a few starters followed by lamb ribs. All were delicious and the lamb ribs were the best we had that we even ordered some to take home. It was a very relaxing atmosphere and felt like home. The location is also superb with green just opposite. Service was also very friendly and made us feel welcomed. Cannot wait to visit again. All in all it was a perfect meal out and well worth a try.

title: Wonderful family run Turkish!
comment: Have visited this restaurant many times while working temporarily in the area. The staff were always very kind and welcoming. The food is always excellent, chicken shish is the best you'll get! The lunch menus are amazing value. Would recommended highly and will come out this was just visit this restaurant!

title: Ash k
comment: Amazing food great staff. Buzzing atmosphere. Already planning my next visit.!!!! If you want great Turkish food then you must try GEZI park

title: Nice Place
comment: Always a busy restaurant, nice atmosphere, food nice, lots of salads ands dips.service good. Would return.

title: Great food, can't stop visiting
comment: I live down the road from this place and in the last few weeks have been in about 4 times. The food is excellent and really reasonable. When it first opened I wasn't too sure about it, but in recent months they've obviously found their feet and it's improved no end. They do takeaway too, which is probably going to play havoc with my waistline because I have to walk past it every night on the way home from work! Highly recommended. Gets pretty busy on a weekend so you definitely need to book.

title: Best Turkish food this side of the Golden Horn
comment: I've been working in Stratford this week and staying up the road from this restaurant. I've ended up having my evening meal from Gezi Park 4 evenings out of 5. All the food I've had has been excellent and everyone at the restaurant is very welcoming.

title: Excellent food and friendly staff
comment: I attended today with work colleagues. The staff were really friendly, the food was cooked to perfection and there was a constant supply of fresh grilled bread with chilli sauce and mint between courses The ambience was just right and there was a mix of business people and families. I have been a few times now but unfortunately I live out of the area. I could do with something like this where I live....lucky Wanstead. I don't normally do this type of thing but I have been consistently impressed and credit where credits due. Paul Redmond

title: Keep an eye on your food and count your chicken cubes
comment: Eaten in here and had carry out. When you eat in, they bully you around , where to sit, when to order, grab and snatch things, bark at you and all very rushed. When you have take out the skewers of meat that are put on the grill seem to drastically reduce in numbers and you only get a few cubes put in your take away. So keep an eye on what you get as they seem to take bits off. Chicken seems pumped full water and not usual texture but edible. Very small portion salad given and meal padded out with bread. Not best I've had in the area. Little man (boss maybe) dictating to you when and where to stand and sit is a really annoying guy. Had to tell him to leave us alone.

title: Great Turkish food
comment: This place is a find. There are no big surprises - it simply serves very good quality and well cooked traditional Turkish food at very reasonable prices. The service is friendly and prompt, making this place ideal for a quick bite after work, or a more leisurely meal.

title: Turkish Delight
comment: Great Meze, great meat and fish kebabs, lovely flat bread , couple of bottles of Efes. Friendly and attentive waitress, not too pricey, job done

title: Gem of Wanstead
comment: Never dissapointed with this place. Meat and bread are always fresh and tasty in a way you cant find anywhere else. Warm atmosphere and friendly service. Definately worth a visit for first timers.

title: It doesn't get better than this.
comment: Home from home, but better food! Out with friends with lots to catch up on. No fuss, laden plates, fresh and tasty, and the ever attentive Julya and Charlie looking after us. A real pleasure every time. Thank you Eddy!

title: Worst service and food ever
comment: We visited this restaurant on Friday night, there were 6 of us. The service from all the waiters/waitresses was dreadful, the worst service I have ever encountered in a restaurant. They were rude as we asked if we could change tables due to a large party making an awful lot of noise next to us. They brought up main courses before the starter plates had been removed. They collected plates even though people were still eating. I did say to the waiter someone is still eating and he said "I know"! The food was very sparse and overcooked.One of our party asked for chips instead of rice to be told NO we cannot do that, so we had to order another portion of chips. When the main meal arrived I said I thought all the main meals came with salad and was told that salad would be coming separately. We had 2 small bowls of salad between 6 of us. The salad had no dressing and was not chopped like a good Turkish restaurant normally does. The staff were very scruffy as was the restaurant. We would never return to this restaurant and advise every body else to avoid. The meals were also very expensive compared to other good Turkish restaurants.

title: Excellent and friendly service and good food to boot!
comment: It was a birthday dinner and the restaurant gave me an excellent dish fruit to share at the end of your meal. I had a delicious mushroom dish, followed by a lamb dish. The waiter was helpful and entertaining. We all enjoyed the food and the service very much.

title: Fantastic wedding reception at Gezi Park, Wanstead
comment: We had our wedding reception at Gezi Park restaurant on Valentine's Day. Our guests loved the food which was plentiful, well prepared and nicely presented. We had the entire rear section of the restaurant to ourselves which was large enough to accommodate 31 guests and private enough without imposing on other customers. The staff were courteous and very helpful in decorating the tables for us. They worked hard on the day and made our wedding reception a memorable and stress free experience.

title: Good but poor service
comment: In comparisons to other Turkish restaurants the food was very good but more on the pretty looks, small portion side, but good quality. The venue is nicely decorated but the atmosphere was dire for lunch. You could hear a pin drop, it almost felt awkward to speak, maybe a bit of music would help and some social interaction from the waitresses, possibly a smile just to break the otherwise strangely tense atmosphere. The venue certainly charges at the higher end for Turkish food in London, but falls well short with service. I spent ages, along with a few other diners staring into what felt like a black whole when trying to get the attention of the waitresses during a time when the restaurant was not busy. It felt like extreme effort for the waitresses to provide a friendly level of service, which essentially let the whole experience down

title: Overpriced turkish food
comment: I went to this restaurant for lunch with a client on Monday 23rd February. I regularly eat in turkish restaurants in north London, Edmonton, palmers Green, Stroud green, Haringay… I usually order the standard mixed grill and it is normally between £23 and £28 depending on where you go. The compatible mixed grill at this restaurant was £45 with a smaller one excluding lamb chops at £35 which is the one we went with. So approx. £10 more for less food, i was expecting something pretty amazing. The food was decent enough, lamb ribs succulent and it was all quite tasty, but the rice portion, bread portion and salad portion were not great and overall I think it was very poor value for money and what I would have expected to pay in Kensington or Central London somewhere. I wouldn't go back to this restaurant as there are so many better ones that are 25% cheaper relatively nearby.

title: Wonderful lunch on a rainy day
comment: My sister, mum and I very much enjoyed our lunch at Gezi Park last week. The food was freshly cooked, memorable and brought back fond memories of holidays in Turkey. We had calamari and filo pastry rolls to start, chicken shish and moussaka to follow, then ended the meal with fresh baklava and Turkish coffee. Everything was delicious and carefully prepared by an obviously very competent chef, and the portions were very generous. The owner (who also served us) was friendly, smiley and chatty. The place was spotlessly clean and cosy. The bill for the three of us was £46.00, which must be a bargain for a three-course meal in London! We would thoroughly recommend Gezi Park and we will be going back.

title: Great atmosphere good service and food
comment: My friend and I tried this restaurant for the first time. Staff very attentive, food was wonderful, prices reasonable to. Will definitely be returning.

title: Enjoyable first visit
comment: Super friendly staff, we had a few laughs,shared two different starters and calamari were superb ! main course I picked Lamb ribs,rice and trimmings, my friend chose Lambs liver,rice and trimmings. just wash down with G&T's and finished with a Turkish coffee,baklava and turkish delight. This was an on the spot choice and very enjoyable, Will return soon.Roy

title: Atmosphere was really nice
comment: Staff was very welcoming, food was nice, deserts especially. Really recommend to eat at this place!!

title: Shoddy service and rude waitress
comment: We booked a table for 4 adults and a high chair for our child. The table they set aside was completely unsuitable so had the child in my lap for the entire meal.  We also ordered the mixed mezze, and they served this and within a minute brought out our main meals. There was now not enough room on our table.  I asked why the main had come out so soon and the waitress told us that when we booked we had been told we had to leave by 20.30. It was only 19.17 at the time. I pointed this out and they then took the main meal away. The waitress at this point was rude.  Heaven knows what they did to it, but I got a heavily charcoal grilled meal back about 20 minutes later.  Absolutely shoddy service and meal was probably spat in. I would not recommend this place if you want to sit down and enjoy your food.  I would recommend Mezze in Woodford Green or even Shish (a but bitter than Gezi). At least they know how to treat their customers.

title: good lunch time deal
comment: food was nice, good deal, i found the waitress very rude...when i asked for water at room temp...her reaction was ' i dont control how it comes out of the taps'... there was a man there who was helpful/friendly...maybe the manager ...i did complain but they didnt seem to take it very seriously but he did serve me room temp water

title: Lovely quiet working lunch
comment: I have already raved about this place, but thought it would be good to try it in a different context to normal dinner: going through papers, and needing to write on a pit stop time frame, and little budget at lunchtime. Just the same, although the only noticeable difference was that I was put to the quiet tables at the back, music was turned down, and I was completely left alone. Wi-fi working? Check. Fixed price of £7.95 good value? Check. Lentil soup and lamb ribs and salad delicious? Check. Ice and lemon in tap water? Check. Another 5 stars. Bang on. Just right. Job done.

title: Good Turkish food
comment: We were given complimentary starters of baked bread and tomato chutney which was a yummy prelude to the mains. The mains we had ordered was a very tasty dish of chicken shish yogurtlu. The ambience was average but the food is very good. The staff are curteous and friendly overall. Service was good. I would certinly recommend this place to frriends and family. Good value for money too. The mains is enough for 2 to share.

title: A lovely evening with friends and family
comment: Six of us went for dinner tonight (Thursday evening). For five of us it was the first time. Staff were extremely welcoming and kind. Atmosphere was very relaxing. We were the second table to arrive, but the last to leave! The food was delicious, we had a selection of dishes for both starters and main which we all shared. It was all beautifully cooked and extremely tasty. The lamb chops were a firm favourite. We are all local to the area and will definitely go back. Thank you Gezi Park for a lovely evening.

title: Turkish Man Delighted
comment: My wife and I have been going to this restaurant since its opened and haven't had a night that I couldn't be more pampered by the professional service and not forgetting to mentioning the high standard of food with generous portions.

title: Superb
comment: I like to try different places but I must say the food here was excellent...., the meat could melt in your mouth. I will be going here again more often, the service and decor is of a high standard and the atmosphere is very good too..., the prices could be a little better but I guess you get what you pay for but the lunch menu is great value.... I would say it a must if your a meat lover...

title: Gezi Park - Wanstead High Street
comment: I think the name should be lamb kebab with lighter fuel. I have been here twice and the first time I went in the service was alright but the food tasted of lighter fuel. When I managed to catch the waiter and explained he did replace it but it still tasted of lighter fuel. I suspect the charcoal grill is started with flaminant and that is what I tasted anyway went back early lunchtime and the same thing happened so wont be going back again. Wine is overpriced as well.

title: Top quality
comment: This truly is a restaurant that you will visit again and again. The staff are amazing and attentive. The food is just amazing very tasty cooked fresh and served with passion. It's not one of those places where you never see the owner. The owner of Gezi park is around a lot making sure the customers are happy a real nice man who genuinely cares. You must visit this restaurant and you will not be disappointed 5 stars from me.

title: Turkish food brought to England
comment: Very Very nice authentic Turkish food excellent starters and then bettered by the main course. Very nice atmosphere and great value for money too you wont leave feeling hungry believe me

title: Great find amongst the plethora of eateries in Wanstead
comment: We had invited some friends to join us for lunch, something we do on a regular basis. One couple travelled from the Guildford area and the other couple from Cambridge. We consider ourselves as foodies and travel to various areas to try whatever is on offer. Having read the reviews through Tripit we decided to go for a Turkish fare.not wanting to take a chance, i called ahead 24 hours and made a reservation for 6 for 1pm. We arrived on time and were shown to our reserved table in this nicely appointed restaurant. The service was great and after perusing the menus we had our drinks, which consisted of 1 bottle of Perrier water, a Cranberry juice, a bottle of Merlot and a Gin and Tonic. The menu was large and there was a fixed lunch section as well as a separate al a carte menu. We ordered Taramasalata, Albanian Liver, Tatsiki and along with copious amounts of bread accompanied by a delicious chili based dip, very moorish. The main course was Moussaka, Lamb chops, Lamb skewer and the 3 guys shared a Gezi Park special. We were warned prior to the special arrived about not overindulging in the delicious bread and dips. The meals were all beautifully cooked and prepared and served. We finished off by taking Turkish coffee accompanied by home made Turkish delight and Baklava.  We were all impressed by the standards, cleanliness and ambiance, definitely a find in amongst all the eating establishments in and around Wanstead. as far as value for money, spot on.  I expect that if you want to have a good meal or even a special occasion then its probably expedient to make a reservation. You wont be disappointed. A great find and thank you for allowing us to enjoy your fabulous fare.

title: My Second Kitchen!!
comment: This place is excellent...I only live around the corner and it truly is my second kitchen!! I really enjoy the food, its always freshly prepared and there's a wide range of dishes on the menu. So much so in fact that a commited carnivore like myself has tried, and enjoyed, a number of their vegetarian offerings. I've been to many a Turkish restaurant in my time and without doubt this rates as one of the best.  The staff are great to deal with, friendly and helpful from the moment you step foot inside the door. Quick service and professionalism are the hall marks of the kitchen and waiters alike.  I'd highly recommend a visit the next time you're in the Wanstead area and you fancy a good meal whether you're solo, with friends or family. Tell them Fenerbache Paul sent you and they'll look after you!!

title: Satisfied first timer
comment: Took 2 colleagues from work on Sunday afternoon. Very relaxed atmosphere. Really enjoyed the mixed meze for 3 which was more than adequate. Calamari was perfect. Really good service. Overall an excellent afternoon out. Went to the loo and noticed the bin was getting a little full. Went an hour later and it had been emptied. Maybe the most unecessary part of my review but it goes to show the attention to detail. Will return without a doubt.

title: Perfect!!
comment: One of best meals I had in a very long time I would recommend this to anyone with their magnificent food, reasonable prices and a very classy atmosphere

title: Excellent food
comment: I have ben this restaurant ones Thé food is excellent. Spacily Sinem waiter Thank you very much. See you sun again.

title: Fantastic Food By the Chef: Ali :)
comment: The food was great!! I went there with some friends and my sister. Recommended by my work colleague. It was Friday night so the restaurant was extremely busy. The food still came out in reasonable time, the service was really friendly. The chef made the food in front of you - looked very authentic. Who was very Lovely and friendly (Ali). Such a lovely evening - the atmosphere was very pleasant. The restaurant looks very classy, I would definitely recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family. You must try. Kind Regards  Reshma

title: Fabulous !
comment: Booked for a table of four at gezi park restaurant and so glad I did . We were seated straight away and meet at the door felt very welcomed . The waitress was lovely and very hands on . The food is cooked infront you in a very clean kitchen. Nice soft music playing and dimmed light's such a warm feeling . The portions are very reasonable and the food is priced well . Food was cleared from the tables befor the next meal . Would highly recommend this restaurant . Thankyou gezi park

title: excellent and excellent :)
comment: I am a Turkish and taste of food and smoothies are very very delicious.I have been there 4 times and i strongly recommended lamb ribs, ezme and baklava. You can test very tasty aryan and fruits as well. Have e great time:)

title: Good food right service
comment: I have visited this restaurant a number of times with my family, I always go for the ribs which Are cooked to perfection. The atmosphere and ambience is amazing. The staff are always kind and attentive with a smile. Would definitely recommend.

title: Great food, great service and great atmosphere
comment: It was my second time at this restaurant, we hadn't booked and though it was a Saturday night and very busy we were accomdated for very quickly to a table.  You are always welcomed at the door with a smile and great service being looked after throughout your dinner.  The food was amazing, selection and variety of food means that there is something to accomodate for everyones needs and tastebuds. The dishes are made freshly in front of you in the open kitchen which is very clean and well maintained.  We also ordered some food for take out and this was catered for on time and with the same great service and quality.  Highly recommend this place if you would like great food and reasonable price with the a great atmosphere.

title: Best BBQ
comment: Every week we go to gezi park restaurant, sometimes we order take away. It has amazing barbecued food, it also has turkish meze's. It has a very friendly atmosphere. One thing that's not good for us, is that it is always busy. Also we have to always arrange a reservation to avoid disappointment.

title: Turkish Gem in Wanstead E11
comment: This family run restaurant won 2 National awards in 2014: both International Food Overall Winner and Readers Choice in the Guardian Food Awards. That's Best in Show in the UK and deservedly so. Easy to overlook for Review on the grounds of close proximity and frequency of visits. The food is outstanding: lamb chops and the freshest pomegranate salad to die for and the Malbec superb. All served up by Julya and the team with charm and hospitality. I don't know anyone with a bad or mediocre word to say. Oh, and good value too, with said lamb chops and Malbec at £25/head, although plenty of veggie and mocktail options if that is not your thing. One of the very best. Really.

title: Excellent Turkish meal!
comment: We went for a walk in Wansted. After a few walks around the area and with a very hot temperature, my girlfriend and I, we decided to eat something fresh and cold. We discovered this restaurant on the high street Wansted. We decided to try the cold mesh dish suitable for two or three. No other works to describe it: really nice, cold, fresh and fulfilling. I will be back there very soon.

title: Disappointing meal at Gezi Park
comment: A Sunday evening at 7.30pm. Plenty of staff but not very good service. Gave up waiting to be offered dessert menu. Annoyed to find bill automatically adds service charge. Food was ok but pricey. Won't be going back :(

title: Very Good Turkish Restaurant
comment: Not a cheap-eat, but meat and fish were deliciously flavoursome and cooked to perfection so I felt it just about offered good value. All-in-all, a good restaurant with particularly excellent seafood. For vegetarians, the falafels were amazing! Service was very good.

title: Turkish delight
comment: Tonight was our first trip to Gezi Park and we will definitely be back. Booked a table for 7pm and place was fairly empty when we got there but by the time we left it was really busy. I think booking is definitely required on Sat night. Lovely waitress took drinks order first. I had never had Turkish wine before and when I ordered it she said if I didn't like it then I could change it. I didn't need to.. Had 2 glasses :-) We had a few different starters.. Haloumi, Turkish sausage and meatballs. All delicious. Nice bread also served. 2 of us went for chicken shish kebabs, 1 had the lamb chops and the other had chicken wings. All were served with rice and salad. Just enough rice.. Sometimes they can give too much. The mains were really tasty. Not much room left for dessert but 2 of them managed to share a piece of cheesecake. This is a lovely restaurant. It was a lovely evening and we could have taken advantage of the outdoor seating but opted for indoors.  Only negative was it was very fast service (some might say that's a good thing). Next time we would order our starters and when finished would order the mains. Less than 120 for 4 people which included 2 large glasses of wine and 2 beers with 4 cokes. Service charge was included. Looking forward to our next visit!

title: Gezi First Timer
comment: We tried to get a table a few weeks ago, but having just wandered in on a Friday evening, there was nothing available for half an hour. The manager took our number and said he would call to let us know when a table was free. We wandered off and found another local restaurant. However, I did receive a call within half an hour, but had to say we would book another time, as we had seen enough to make us want to go back. This time, we booked in advance and we were not sorry we did. We were warmly welcomed when we arrived by staff who were impressively attentive, engaging and friendly throughout. As it was our first time here, we decided to choose a starter each and then a mixed grilled meat platter. The starters were generous in size and, as there were four of us, we were pleased that there were at least 4 pieces in each portion, as opposed to those annoying places where they insist on supplying on 3 to a party of 4. The sarma and calamari were particularly good. The platter, as with the starters, was of a very generous size. We had a mix which included chicken wings, lamb chops, lamb ribs etc, together with rice and salad. Each of the meat portions were wonderfully cooked and flavoured and we only just made it through the course. I can only comment on one of the desserts, as two of us never have them and one does not eat chocolate, so that limited her choice to ice cream, which she did not want. However, the cheesecake portion ordered by my son soon vanished! Despite the comments from a previous reviewer, we found the staff to be very busy, but always friendly and efficient.  As for the cost, we paid £82, including tip, so at just over £20 per head, I thought that was excellent value.  We eat out quite regularly and always score our experience and this one scored very highly. We will be back and suggest you try it out too. All in all, a very relaxed and enjoyable meal, so this one come highly recommended.

title: Best kebabs
comment: This is a lovely restaurant where the staff are very friendly and helpful. We were celebrating a birthday and so enjoyed cocktails, starters, a main course and dessert, all of which were excellent. You are given free appetizers and the most delicious flatbread whilst waiting for the food which almost filled us up! Most of us had kebabs and they were excellent. Only four people could manage a dessert which included the cheesecake and rice pudding which surprised us by being cold but still delicious. If you like kebabs you won't be disappointed. The bill for 8 people came to £210 including service charge.

title: excellent!
comment: I did another review under the previous name of place Hadley House mezi restaurant. Excellent, highly recommended!

title: Great food
comment: Great food, good atmosphere, very busy which made service a bit slow, but the friendly staff made the wait acceptable, service charge added to the bill we would have preferred to make the decision on overall service ourselves.

title: Nice food
comment: Very busy restaurant, booking is best. Flatbread and dips lovely start to meal. Nice chicken kebabs very tender and tasty lots of nice salad. Staff very friendly, good service. Service charged added to bill do not like that ,like to tip upon service received. Would return.

title: Great food, highly recommended!
comment: I have paid ma second visit to this restaurant and absolutely loved it! They seem to have a standard and both my visits were very much enjoyed. I eat out quite often and also visited the other turkish restaurants in this area however did not find the same quality. I am a vegetarian and had the veg mousakka which was amazing and my partner had the mixed kebab. The portions were huge and we could not manage to finish it all. The rice and salad was just as perfect. So many to choose from in the menu. Would I return? Definately. Highly recommended!!

title: A Great Turkish Restaurant
comment: The Four of us ate here for lunch on Saturday having seen that the restaurant was packed the previous Friday evening. We had the Mezes, halloumi and calamari. They also very kindly changed the Tarama to Tabouleh in the Meze. The food was really fresh and delicious and the grilled flatbreads were tasty. The chairs were very comfortable and the staff were welcoming and charming. Overall a very pleasant experience and one we would heartily recommend.
